intro: Mahernia rotundata, commonly known as the round-leaved mahernia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its rounded, succulent leaves and produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, also known as the ice plant family, which is known for its adaptations to dry conditions. Mahernia rotundata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
